metadata.title: Procedural Enclosure Toolkit - Statute Database
metadata.verification_required: All citations must be verified by user before filing. This database is reference only.

2219.title: Form and content of order
2219.text: Every order shall be in writing and contain a determination of the motion and a statement of the grounds therefor.
2219.usage: Core authority for procedural enclosure demanding written orders
key_cases: Apfel v. Prudential-Bache Secs. Inc., 81 N.Y.2d 470 (1993)

2214.title: Time for service of motion papers
2214.text: A motion shall be made returnable at a time not later than the latest date permitted for noticing a case or matter to be heard...

3212.title: Motion for summary judgment
3212.text: Any party may move for summary judgment...

5515.title: Taking an appeal as of right; method
5515.text: An appeal as of right is taken by filing and serving a notice of appeal...

a.text: Upon an appeal from a judgment or order..., the court which rendered the judgment or made the order, or the appellate division, may stay the enforcement of the judgment or order during the pendency of the appeal upon such terms as may be just...

7801.title: Article 78 proceeding defined
7801.text: The only method of challenging a determination of a body or officer is by a proceeding under this article...

7803.title: Grounds for relief in Article 78
7803.text: Whether the body or officer failed to perform a duty enjoined upon it by law

7804.title: Procedure
7804.text: The proceeding shall be instituted by a petition...

nycrr.title: New York Codes, Rules and Regulations

202.48.title: Submission of orders, judgments and decrees for signature
202.48.text: All orders and judgments shall state the relief granted or denied...
202.48.usage: Mandates written decisions in trial courts

100.2.title: Judicial Conduct - Integrity and Impartiality
100.2.text: A judge shall... act at all times in a manner that promotes public confidence in the integrity and impartiality of the judiciary.

100.3.title: Judicial Conduct - Right to be heard
100.3.text: A judge shall accord to every person who has a legal interest in a proceeding... the right to be heard according to law.
100.3.usage: Due process requirement for judicial conduct

1240.title: Procedures for Attorneys in Disciplinary Matters

216.1.title: Access to court records
216.1.text: Court records shall be available to the public...

90.title: Attorney discipline
90.text: Attorneys convicted of felonies; removal from office, disbarment

87.title: Access to agency records
87.text: Each agency shall... make available for public inspection and copying all records...

1028.title: Orders of disposition in child protective proceedings

1331.title: Federal question jurisdiction
1331.text: The district courts shall have original jurisdiction of all civil actions arising under the Constitution, laws, or treaties of the United States.

1332.title: Diversity jurisdiction
1332.text: The district courts shall have original jurisdiction of all civil actions where the matter in controversy exceeds... $75,000...

1343.title: Civil rights jurisdiction
1343.text: Original jurisdiction of any civil action authorized by law to be commenced by any person... to redress the deprivation, under color of any State law...

1361.title: Mandamus jurisdiction
1361.text: The district courts shall have original jurisdiction of any action in the nature of mandamus to compel an officer or employee of the United States...

1391.title: Venue
1391.text: Venue requirements for federal civil actions

1983.title: Civil action for deprivation of rights
1983.text: Every person who, under color of any statute, ordinance, regulation, custom, or usage... subjects, or causes to be subjected, any citizen... to the deprivation of any rights, privileges, or immunities secured by the Constitution and laws, shall be liable...
1983.usage: Federal civil rights actions for constitutional violations
key_cases: Monell v. Department of Social Services, 436 U.S. 658 (1978)

26.title: Duty to disclose; general provisions governing discovery

52.title: Findings and conclusions by the court
52.text: In an action tried on the facts without a jury... the court must find the facts specially and state its conclusions of law separately.

3.title: Appeal as of right - how taken
3.text: An appeal permitted by law as of right from a district court to a court of appeals may be taken only by filing a notice of appeal with the district clerk...

4.title: Appeal as of right - when taken
4.text: 30 days from entry of judgment (60 days if United States is a party)
